cluster_relations.rel_desc: The size of black holes is a property characterizing black holes.
remarks: This is somewhat intrinsic but represented as a relation for context.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Beauty is presented as an aesthetic quality of black holes.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Black Hole Aesthetic and Conceptual Qualities

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links a property, attribute, or quality node to the entity that bears this property.
args.justification: In both relations, the subject is a specific property/quality (size, beauty) and the object is the entity (black holes) that possesses this property. They share identical predicate semantics: a property belonging to an entity. Normalizing them under a single predicate 'is_property_of' simplifies the schema and fits both cases.

Both relations describe an attribute/quality of an entity (black holes). Grouping them under a property-focused relation class captures that the subject is a descriptive property of the object, independent of whether it is physical (size) or conceptual/aesthetic (beauty).

The primary semantic dimension is that these edges express attributes/properties of an entity, not composition, causality, or hierarchy. An ATTRIBUTE group best captures that these relations encode characteristic features of black holes.
